resources.string: Nickname must have at least 6 characters.
Password must have at least 6 characters.
You must be connected to the internet to visualize rankings!
You will lose your progress on history. Are you sure you want to exit?
You have already acquired this element!
It seems like you are out of energy, Explorer!
Answer the following question to recover some energy!
Edit your Explorer\'s nickname. Changes could take a while to take effect.
Texto longo do Professor para teste da fragment Texto longo do Professor para teste da fragment Texto longo do Professor para teste da fragment Texto longo do Professor para teste da fragment
Do you wish to go through the tutorial now?
Now you will learn how to use this app!
Do you wish to leave the tutorial?
Welcome to the tutorial!\nNow you will learn how to use this app!
This is your energy, keep track of how many elements you can register with it!\nRemember that when you run out of energy, you can answer a question to recover some of it!
Here you can answer a question to recover some of your lost energy, if you don\'t have enough to register a new element!
Here you can register elements! Remember you\'ll lose some energy for every registered element, even if you already have it!
Here you can visualizethe registered element. Remember you will earn points every time you reigster a new element!
Here you can take a new picture of the registered element.
Here you can see more information about the element.
When registering a history element, a special display is shown!
Here you can keep track of your score. It is the sum of all points acquired from the start of the game!
Here you can keep track of your history elements during the trail according to their respective stage.\nRemember this is only visible by the time you register the first history element!
Here you can access every element that has been registered, organized by their respective books!
Here you can access all the 3 books that constitute the Almanac!\nRemember that each of them represent a different stage!
Here you can browse the books and check the elements registered in their respective stages!
Here you may access more information about a particular element!
When clicking on the element, you\'ll be able to read its data and see its respective picture.
Here it is possible to visualize the date you registered this element.
Here you can access several options this app has to offer, as in:
Here you can see your achievements unlocked by reaching certain objectives at the game!
Here you can see the ranking of the top 10 Explorers!
It is possible to observe the top 10 Explorers and your position highlighted!
Here you have access to the same screen through the Map button mentioned before.
Here you have access to some options about your account.
Here you can edit your nickname!
Here you can delete your account.\nRemember this action cannot be undone!
Here you can sign out of your account.\nRemember that by logging out you will lose all your History progress, but your elements won\'t be lost.
You are in this tutorial, and you can access it any time you want.
Lastly, here you can access additional information about the Missão Nascente project.

Now, some general advice before the star of the trail: bring your water bottle, wear jeans and comfortable shoes.\n\nBring at least one assistant (friends, relatives or a instructor)! Besides being more entertaining, you can help each other if you are in doubt or tired.

Missão Nascente is an app for those who like to simultaneously have fun and learn about the natural beauty of the Cerrado. Using it, you register elements of the spring trail of the "Cabeça-de-Veado" stram, at Brasília Botanical Garden. You search for elements and interact with professors that tell you what you need to know.

Moreover, you answer questions to recharge your energy, which is used to identify QR Codes corresponding to elements dispersed throughout the trail. This is not an easy task, because your energy goes down with every new register. But don't worry, it also recharges over time!

 The app also has other ways to keep you entertained, Explorer of the Cerrado. A ranking to compare you and the top Explorers of the trail and achievements are also shown.
The app was developed on a partnership between Software Engineering students at Brasília Univeristy (UnB) and the team of Technical Scientific Superintendence of Brasília Botanical Garden.

Allan Jeffrey
